title: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: Bug 3622: New Package Wizard has confusing message
OB: When invoking the 'New Java Package' action in the IDE, a message appears at the top stating 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists', even when the package name field is empty. This message is confusing as it is unclear what it is referring to or if it is an error.
EB: The message should be removed or clarified to provide relevant information about the situation when the package name field is empty. If it is a warning or error, it should be displayed with appropriate visual indicators like red color or error icon.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 

1. Create a new Java project. 
2. Select the project. 
3. Invoke the 'New Java Package' action.
